headline.main: Yugoslav Guerrillas Invade Italy; Others Attack Germans in Force; YUGOSLAV TROOPS ENTER NORTH ITALY

lead_paragraph: LONDON, July 31 -- Yugoslav guerrillas, slashing through Italian lines, have fought their way into the Udine district of northeastern Italy, while other sizable forces of Gen. Draja Mikhailovitch's patriot army have begun a strong attack against German troops along the old Austrian-Croat frontier, a Yugoslav spokesman said tonight.
abstract: Balkans: Gers reinforce Balkan garrisons from which Ital troops are withdrawing; Field Marshal Rommel reptd in command; Gers prepare for fierce fighting, this area; Ger troops replace Ital garrisons, Dodecanese and Cyclades Islands; strategic value of Larissa, Greek mainland port discussed
